item.title: 贝森特称特朗普关于起诉其美联储主席提名人选的言论是玩笑
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特·贝森特周五强调，特朗普总统上周末称若美联储主席提名人凯文·沃什不降息就起诉他的言论纯属玩笑。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Friday stressed that President Donald Trump was joking when he said over the weekend that he could sue Kevin Warsh, his nominee to lead the Federal Reserve, if he doesn't lower interest rates.】

item.title: Hims公司49美元减肥药动摇投资者对现金支付肥胖市场的信心
item.description: Hims & Hers公司推出诺和诺德Wegovy减肥药49美元复合版本的策略，正引发肥胖治疗股的剧烈震荡。此举不仅引发对该行为合法性的争议，更威胁到制药商在美国蓬勃发展的自费医疗市场中的收益。【原文：Hims & Hers' gambit to sell a $49 compounded version of Novo Nordisk's Wegovy pill is rattling obesity shares, sparking debate about the legality of the move and threatening drugmaker returns in the burgeoning U.S. cash-pay market.】

item.title: 詹妮弗·加纳创立的Once Upon a Farm公司于纽约证券交易所上市首日估值达8.45亿美元
item.description: 由演员詹妮弗·加纳联合创立的儿童有机食品公司"童话农场"，周五在纽约证券交易所首次公开募股时，其股价较发行价上涨16.7%，公司估值达到8.449亿美元。【原文：Once Upon a Farm , the children's organic food company co-founded by actor Jennifer Garner, fetched an $844.9 million valuation as its shares opened 16.7% above the offer price in its New York Stock Exchange debut on Friday.】

item.title: 嘉能可将专注短期资产处置，因力拓交易仍无定论
item.description: 嘉能可与力拓的合并谈判破裂，这家总部位于瑞士的矿业集团很可能将专注于资产出售，以强化其铜业务组合。【原文：Glencore's failed merger talks with Rio Tinto , have left the Swiss-based mining group likely to focus on asset sales as it works to strengthen its copper portfolio.】

item.title: 比利时Agomab Therapeutics公司估值达7.16亿美元，纳斯达克首日上市股价下跌
item.description: Agomab Therapeutics公司估值达7.164亿美元，其股票周五上市首日下跌约8%，因投资者对新股仍持审慎态度。【原文：Agomab Therapeutics secured a valuation of $716.4 million, after its shares fell about 8% in their debut on Friday, as investors remain selective about new offerings.】

item.title: Exclusive: Williams weighs buying gas-producing assets to enhance AI energy supply to hyperscalers, sources say
item.description: 知情人士透露，威廉姆斯公司正考虑收购美国天然气生产资产，这对能源基础设施运营商而言实属罕见举措。此举旨在确保天然气供应，以支持其面向超大规模企业及数据中心客户的一站式服务。【原文：Williams Companies is exploring buying natural gas production in the United States, a rare foray for an energy infrastructure operator, as it aims to secure natural gas supplies to support its one-stop-shop offering to hyperscalers and data center clients, three people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 阿根廷贸易部长称与美国的贸易协议不会排挤中国
item.description: 阿根廷外交部长帕布罗·基尔诺周五表示，本周签署的阿根廷与美国关键矿产协议并不排除中国对该国矿业领域的投资。【原文：A deal on critical minerals between Argentina and the United States signed this week does not rule out Chinese investment in the country's mining sector, Argentine Foreign Minister Pablo Quirno said on Friday.】

item.title: 四大图表解读科技巨头季度业绩：人工智能投资激增与云计算业务增长
item.description: 美国科技巨头预测今年支出将激增，因其正加倍押注人工智能领域，这加剧了投资者对这些高成本投资能否产生足够回报以支撑该行业高估值的审视。【原文：U.S. tech giants have predicted their spending would surge this year as they double down on artificial intelligence, sharpening investor scrutiny over whether these costly bets would generate enough returns to justify the sector's high valuations.】

item.title: 美联储杰斐逊对经济持谨慎乐观态度，认为就业市场趋稳，通胀率下降
item.description: 美联储副主席菲利普·杰斐逊周五表示，他对2026年的经济前景持"谨慎乐观"态度，预计经济增长将略高于趋势水平，劳动力市场趋于稳定，通胀率将重新回落至美联储2%的目标水平。【原文：Federal Reserve Vice Chair Philip Jefferson said on Friday he was "cautiously optimistic" about the 2026 economic outlook, with growth expected to remain slightly above trend, the labor market stabilizing, and inflation resuming a decline to the U.S. central bank's 2% target.】

item.title: 美国法官驳回Compass公司针对Zillow在线房屋挂牌信息提出的禁令申请
item.description: 周五，一名联邦法官驳回了美国最大住宅房地产经纪公司Compass要求Zillow在其房地产平台上增加房源的禁令申请。【原文：A federal judge on Friday rejected a bid by Compass , the largest U.S. residential real estate brokerage, for an injunction requiring Zillow to list more homes on its real estate platforms.】

item.title: TPG收购电力基础设施企业Sabre Industries多数股权，交易额达35亿美元
item.description: 私募股权公司TPG已同意从黑石集团手中收购Sabre Industries的多数股权，两家公司周五宣布了这一消息。据两位知情人士透露，这笔交易对这家电力基础设施公司的估值约为35亿美元。【原文：Private markets firm TPG has agreed to buy a majority stake in Sabre Industries from Blackstone , the companies said on Friday, in a deal two people familiar with the matter said valued the power infrastructure company at around $3.5 billion.】

item.title: 美联储官员戴利称美国经济前景"岌岌可危"
item.description: 旧金山联邦储备银行行长玛丽·戴利周五表示，她认为美国经济正处于"岌岌可危"的境地。她指出，尽管企业普遍持谨慎乐观态度，但家庭信心却相对薄弱——毕竟那些至今仍犹豫是否大规模裁员的企业，可能随时改变策略。【原文：San Francisco Federal Reserve Bank President Mary Daly said on Friday she feels the U.S. economy is in a "precarious" position. While businesses are largely cautiously optimistic, she said, households are less confident, given that businesses so far hesitant to make mass layoffs could rapidly switch gears.】

item.title: 美国消费者信心指数二月份小幅回升
item.description: 一项调查显示，尽管劳动力市场持续令人担忧且生活成本不断攀升，美国消费者信心在2月上旬略有改善。【原文：U.S. consumer sentiment improved marginally in early February amid lingering worries about the labor market and the rising cost of living, a survey showed on Friday.】

item.title: 人工智能贸易出现分化，投资者选择更加谨慎
item.description: 全球人工智能产业正面临分化，飙升的资本支出、不断增加的债务负担以及对技术红利归属的质疑，迫使投资者划出更清晰的界限。当前市场正沿着股票、行业乃至区域维度呈现分裂态势。【原文：The global AI trade is starting to fracture as soaring capex, rising debt loads and doubts over who will profit from the technology force investors to draw sharper lines. Markets are now splitting across stocks, sectors and even regions.】

item.title: 欧盟将对1098亿美元美国进口商品的关税暂停措施延长六个月
item.description: 欧盟官方公报显示，在特朗普总统对格陵兰岛的主张及加征关税威胁引发的紧张局势缓和后，欧盟将暂停对价值930亿欧元（1098亿美元）的美国进口商品征收关税，该措施将再延长六个月。【原文：The European Union is suspending tariffs on 93 billion euros ($109.8 billion) of U.S. imports for a further six months after an easing of tensions over U.S. President Donald Trump's claims on Greenland and threats of new tariffs, according to a filing in the EU official journal.】

item.title: 巴克莱称，投资者自2023年以来首次将目光投向美国对冲基金之外
item.description: 投资者正寻求降低对美国对冲基金的持仓，这是自2023年以来首次出现此类动向。自美国总统唐纳德·特朗普4月实施全面解放日关税以来，有关"抛售美国资产"的交易讨论持续发酵。【原文：Investors are looking to decrease their exposure to U.S. hedge funds for the first time since 2023, as talk of the "Sell America" trade has simmered since U.S. President Donald Trump's sweeping Liberation Day levies in April.】

item.title: 欧洲央行的安全网是欧盟争取新盟友计划的一部分
item.description: 欧洲央行计划放宽外国央行获取欧元融资的限制，这是欧洲新兴战略的最新举措，旨在赢得贸易和政治盟友，并在与中美对抗中保持自身地位。【原文：The ECB’s plan to make it easier for foreign central banks to secure funding in euros is the latest part of Europe’s emerging strategy to win trade and political friends and hold its own against the United States and China.】

item.title: 奇瑞汽车因延误将推迟至今年在西班牙投产
item.description: 奇瑞汽车公司高管周五表示，这家中国汽车制造商将在今年"尽快"于西班牙启动自有品牌汽车的生产。此前该公司首家欧洲工厂的投产计划曾多次推迟。【原文：Chinese carmaker Chery will start production of its own vehicles in Spain "as soon as possible" this year, a top executive said on Friday, after successive delays to what will be its first factory in Europe.】

item.title: 中国承诺加强虚拟货币监管
item.description: 中国央行周五发布公告称，中国承诺将进一步加强对虚拟货币及相关非法经营活动的管控。【原文：China on Friday pledged to further tighten restrictions on virtual currencies and related illicit business activities, according to a notice released by China's central bank.】

item.title: 菲利普莫里斯公司预测年度利润将因尼古丁袋销售而大幅增长
item.description: 菲利普莫里斯国际公司周五预测年度利润将超出预期，押注其主力尼古丁袋品牌Zyn的强劲销售表现，同时该公司正努力在竞争加剧中捍卫市场份额。【原文：Philip Morris International forecast higher-than-expected annual profit on Friday, betting on strong sales of its leading nicotine pouch label, Zyn, even as it strives to defend market share from rising competition.】

item.title: 行业组织称，今年全球芯片销售额预计将突破万亿美元大关
item.description: 美国半导体行业协会周五表示，今年全球半导体销售额预计将达到1万亿美元。【原文：Global semiconductor sales are expected to hit $1 trillion this year, the Semiconductor Industry Association said on Friday.】

item.title: 独家：欧元区财长将审议欧元稳定币及增发联合债券以提升欧元地位
item.description: 欧元区财长将于2月16日讨论如何通过发行欧元计价的稳定币及增加欧盟共同债务，来提升欧元的全球作用并增强欧洲的经济安全。一份为会议准备的文件显示了上述内容。【原文：Euro zone finance ministers will discuss on February 16 how to boost the global role of the euro and strengthen Europe's economic security through issuing euro-denominated stablecoins and more joint EU debt, a paper prepared for them shows.】

item.title: 芝加哥期权交易所第四季度利润因期权交易激增而上升
item.description: 芝加哥期权交易所集团周五公布的数据显示，该公司第四季度利润实现增长，市场波动性上升推动了该交易所运营商的期权交易量。【原文：Cboe Global Markets posted a rise in fourth-quarter profit on Friday, as elevated market volatility helped boost options trading volumes at the exchange operator.】

item.title: 纽威尔品牌公司宣布将下调Rubbermaid和Graco产品价格，以应对消费者日益节俭的消费趋势。
item.description: 纽威尔品牌公司发言人周五向路透社透露，旗下Rubbermaid食品储存品牌及婴儿护理品牌Graco的多款核心产品将降价最高15%。【原文：Newell Brands is cutting prices by up to 15% at its Rubbermaid food storage brand and on several core items in baby-care portfolio Graco, a spokesperson told Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: 安德玛季度销售额降幅收窄，假日需求保持稳定
item.description: 安德玛周五公布的第三季度营收降幅低于预期，这家运动服饰制造商通过简化产品组合的转型举措，在关键假日季成功稳定了需求。【原文：Under Armour posted a smaller-than-expected drop in third-quarter revenue on Friday, as turnaround efforts by the sportswear maker to simplify product assortment helped stabilize demand during the key holiday season.】

item.title: 晨间竞标：杀死工作的机器人崛起？
item.description: 迈克·多兰和ROI团队本周末最期待阅读、观看和收听的内容。【原文：Everything Mike Dolan and the ROI team are excited to read, watch and listen to over the weekend.】

item.title: 特斯拉正在中国培训其人工智能技术，据当地媒体报道
item.description: 据中国媒体财联社周五援引特斯拉副总裁陶林的话报道，特斯拉正在中国运营一个人工智能训练中心，专注于本地应用和辅助驾驶。【原文：Tesla is operating an artificial intelligence training centre in China focusing on local application and assisted driving, Chinese media outlet Cailianshe reported on Friday, citing the company's Vice President Tao Lin.】

item.title: 科技股暴跌后期货企稳，亚马逊因人工智能资本支出增加而下跌
item.description: 美国股市期货周五企稳，此前科技股在本周早些时候遭遇重挫。与此同时，亚马逊股价下跌，该公司成为最新一家加大人工智能项目投入的科技巨头。【原文：U.S. stock index futures steadied on Friday after a bruising selloff in technology shares earlier this week, while Amazon dropped as it became the latest Big Tech company to crank up its spending toward artificial-intelligence initiatives.】

item.title: 更昂贵的iPhone？全球内存芯片短缺将苹果推上风口浪尖
item.description: 随着全球内存芯片短缺冲击智能手机市场，一个关键问题正从硅谷到深圳引发热议：苹果将选择提价，还是牺牲利润以赢得新客户？【原文：As the global memory chip shortage hits the smartphone market, a key question is echoing from Silicon Valley to Shenzhen: Will Apple raise prices, or sacrifice profit to gain new customers?】

item.title: 凯雷集团季度利润因私募股权交易增长
item.description: 资产管理公司凯雷集团周五公布的财报显示，其第四季度利润实现增长，这得益于私募股权部门的交易收入以及信贷和二级市场业务的稳健收益。【原文：Asset manager Carlyle Group posted a rise in fourth-quarter profit on Friday, helped by income from deals at its private-equity arm and solid gains across its credit and secondaries businesses.】
